contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox officeholder |name = Kaye Darveniza |honorific-suffix = MLC |image = |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1955|2|15|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Mooroopna, Victoria]] |office1 = Member of the [[Victorian Legislative Council]] |party = [[Australian Labor Party]] |occupation = |term_start1 = 25 November 2006 |portfolio = }} '''Kaye Mary Darveniza''' (born 15 February 1955) is an [[Australia]]n politician. She has been an [[Australian Labor Party]] member of the [[Victorian Legislative Council]] since September 1999, representing Melbourne West Province. In the 2006 Victoria State election, she transferred to the [[Northern Victoria Region]] and was re-elected. Darveniza was born in the town of [[Mooroopna, Victoria|Mooroopna]] and educated in [[Shepparton, Victoria|Shepparton]]. She studied nursing, becoming a registered psychiatric nurse in 1975. She then left the workforce for six years, before returning in 1981. In 1986, Darveniza became involved with the trade union movement, becoming an organiser with the [[Health and Community Services Union]]. Three years later, she rose to become the union's state secretary - a position she held for ten years, until her election to parliament. She also acted as the national president of the Hospital Employees Federation of Australia from 1990 to 1991, and as the national vice president of the [[Health Services Union]] of Australia from 1991 to 1999.<ref name=pbio> {{cite web|title=Kaye Darveniza | publisher=[[Parliament of Victoria]] |url=http://www.parliament.vic.gov.au/handbook/searchresult.cfm?menuid=1&memberId=80 | accessdate= 5 February 2010}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} </ref> At the [[Victorian state election, 1999|1999 state election]], Darveniza shifted from the union movement into politics, winning Labor preselection for the seat of Melbourne West Province. After Labor won a surprise victory, the newly elected Darveniza was given a parliamentary secretary position. In her first term in office, she also served on both the Economic Development Committee and the Legislative Council Printing Committee from 1999 to 2002.<ref name=pbio/> Darveniza is a member of the [[Labor Unity]] faction. ==References== {{reflist}} {{VicCurrentMLCs}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Darveniza, Kaye | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 15 February 1955 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Mooroopna, Victoria | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Darveniza, Kaye}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian Labor Party politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Victorian Legislative Council]] [[Category:People from Shepparton]] [[Category:Australian women in politics]]
